result.execSummary:
The defendant Jean Paquette was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes: Probation may be transferred to Walworth County.

miscConds.notes: Pay DV surcharge plus all other costs and surcharges, including DNA surcharge and restitution if ordered. Bail on deposit, if any, to apply. Remainder to be paid during the period of probation or a civil judgment will be issued.
Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the No Contact Order; and due to this DV conviction she may never possess firearms or ammunition.
Mental health evaluation. Take all prescribed medications.

No contact with victim unless approved by the Court.
No contact with firearms.

Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.
Pay supervision fees.
AODA assessment. Comply with any treatment.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Random urine screens.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jean Paquette

defendant.name: Paquette, Jean
defendant.address: 1624 East St Francis Avenue, St Francis, WI 53235

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Invoide forwarded to Accounts Payable in the amount of $375.00 to Behavioral Consaltants INC for service on 10-04,07,06-2015. Copy in file.

Defendant Jean Paquette in court with attorney Brian Christopher Hagner. Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab  
Doctor's report received and filed.  Parties reviewed report and do not contest findings.  Court found defendant competent to proceed and reinstated proceedings.  
Defendant wants to change her plea.
  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.
.
Sentencing continued....
.
  Statements by each counsel and defendant as to sentencing.  
Court sentenced the defendant to serve 60 days in the House of Correction with credit for 2 days served. 
 Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 14 months with the following conditions:
- Mental health evaluation; take all prescribed medications.
- AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.
- Maintain absolute sobriety; random urine screens.
- Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.
- No contact with victim unless approved by the court.
- No contact with firearms.
- Pay DV surcharge plus all other costs and surcharges, including DNA surcharge and restitution if ordered, bail on deposit, if any, to apply; remainder to be paid during the period of probation or a civil judgment will be issued.
- Pay supervision fees.
-  Probation may be transferred to Walworth County.
 
Received and filed: 
Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation. 
Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Dr's report received and filed.
cab

JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
cab

Defendant Jean Paquette in court with attorney Brian Christopher Hagner.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
cab
Defense counsel informs the court that he believes that the defendant is not competent to proceed.   Defense entered a plea of guilty and not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect. 
The Forensic Unit was notifed and a date for the defendant's examination was scheduled for 10/05/2015 at 12:00 p.m. Defendant instructed the defendant to be sure to appear for her examination.

Court did not appoint a specific doctor to examine the defendant for NGI  pursuant to Wisc. stats.  971.16(2).   Court ordered case adjourned for return on the doctor's report to Branch 36.
Filed, signed Order for Examination.
  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for October 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jean Paquette in court with attorney Brian Christopher Hagner.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense counsel requests case be set for Plea & Sentencing. All conditions of bail remain in effect. Case adjourned for Plea & Sentencing to branch 36.   Parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Judge Jeffrey Kremers, Branch 36 in Courthouse room 502.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.
   Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription or no dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with DENNIS H.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Jean Paquette in court with attorney Terese M. Dick.  Defendant Jean Paquette in custody.  William Patrick Pipp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
